title: How to Personalize Your Pencil

steps.headline: Get a brand new pencil.
steps.description: Make sure that the eraser is the color that you want. But the paint on the wood of the pencil doesn't matter.

steps.headline: Get a pair of scissors and open them.
steps.description: Use the blade of the scissors to scrape off the paint on the wood of the pencil.

steps.headline: Use some permanent markers to color the plain wood once all the paint is scraped off.
If you want to, get the hammer and put a hole through one of the dents on the metal part of the pencil with a nail.
Take the needle and string, and poke it through the hole.
Once the strings are through, either braid it, string beads on it, or tie it to a key ring to make it a key chain.
Put a pencil grip on the pencil if you want to.

text: Get a brand new pencil. Make sure that the eraser is the color that you want. But the paint on the wood of the pencil doesn't matter. Get a pair of scissors and open them. Use the blade of the scissors to scrape off the paint on the wood of the pencil. Use some permanent markers to color the plain wood once all the paint is scraped off.  If you want to, get the hammer and put a hole through one of the dents on the metal part of the pencil with a nail. Then pull the nail out. Take the needle and string, and poke it through the hole.  Once the strings are through, either braid it, string beads on it, or tie it to a key ring to make it a key chain.  Sharpen the pencil.  Put a pencil grip on the pencil if you want to.  Enjoy your pencil!
